thoughts.text: It seems that the `list_files` command did not return any files. I will use the `execute_shell` command to list all files in the current directory.
thoughts.reasoning: The `list_files` command did not return any files. I want to list all files in the current directory. The `execute_shell` command can be used to execute a shell command to list all files in the current directory.
thoughts.plan: - Use the `execute_shell` command with the command_line argument set to `ls -al` to list all files in the current directory.
thoughts.criticism: I should make sure that the `execute_shell` command is executed in the correct directory.
thoughts.speak: I will use the `execute_shell` command to list all files in the current directory.
